intro: Juncus lampocarpus var. acutiflorus, commonly known as the narrowleaf rush, is a perennial plant native to coastal regions of western North America. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along shorelines and tidal marshes. The plant features slender, grass-like stems that are often densely clustered. Its small, spike-like inflorescences bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
